thought: The website is accessible. Now I need to extract the text from the HTML to analyze the content.
observation: Shelter Associates | ENHANCING LIVES OF THE URBAN POOR  Home About Us Financials Media Contact Us Sanitation One Home One Toilet Solid Waste Management Menstrual Hygiene Housing Research Slum Rehabilitation Ongoing Projects Data Statistical Data Spatial Data Plus Code Other Interventions Community Engagement COVID-19 Donate Now Select Page ENHANCING LIVES OF THE URBAN POOR G Focus Areas Our robust model identifies critical gaps in slum sanitation and facilitates individual toilets to slum dwellers, while creating behavioral change in communities around Wash, waste segregation and menstrual hygiene… Know More Not just affordable housing, we ensure land rights and security of tenure while involving communities in designing fully-functional, liveable homes completing the transformation from slums to societies… We have pioneered the use of Geographic Information System (GIS) technology for poverty mapping in the late 90’s and use spatial data to improve the delivery of essential services in urban slums.. OUR Story A passion to transform the lives of the urban poor drove architect Pratima Joshi and her two friends to lay the foundation of Shelter Associates (SA) 3 decades back. Using the objective strength of data and sensitivity lent by deep community engagement, SA creates a level playing field where multiple stakeholders can easily collaborate to achieve a shared vision of equitable access to essential services. This changes the power dynamic and the communities becomes equal partners in this continuously evolving story of urban development. Know About Us Building communities through Mobilization The urban slum communities are our partners in this journey of ensuring equitable distribution of rights and essential services to all. We engage with them    through a host of educational and empowering developmental activities. Different types of formal and informal activities are conducted that are impacting  individuals of all age groups and genders. Also, innovative IEC Materials are developed to further involve the communities in a fun and engaging way.. Impact Slum Houses Surveyed Home Toilets Facilitated Individuals Rehabilitated Through Housing Digital Locational Addresses Individuals Impacted - Directly & Indirectly We contribute to the following Sustainable Development Goals Click Here to know more about the 17 SDGs latest happenings हम !! UN Women Coffee Table Book Titled HUM | When Women Lead was unveiled in Delhi. The book featuring SA Founder-Executive Director, Pratima Joshi is Supported by the Ford Foundation. ‘Hum’ shines a spotlight on the journeys of inspiring women leaders throughout India. Watch the full video here Shelter Associates Wins Infosys Foundation's Aarohan Social Innovation Award 2023 SA was presented the Aarohan Social Innovation Awards 2023 by Mrs. Sudha Murthy under the Women Empowerment category for our unique data-driven sanitation model called the ‘One Home One Toilet’. We thank our supporters, partners, well-wishers and the communities for their unflinching trust and support. Click to watch the video made by Infosys Foundation on SA. Big WINS for SA! We are very excited to announce that Shelter Associates has won the SWACHHOTSAV WINS Awards for our sanitation programmes in both Navi Mumbai and Pune Municipal Corporation! The first edition of Women Icons Leading Swacchata(WINS) was launched by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs to recognise and celebrate the impact of women-led organisations in sanitation and waste management. From leadership to community engagement, our sanitation programmes have been led by strong and passionate women. SA Founder-Director, Pratima Joshi awarded INDUSEM’s ‘Samajik Abhiyantrik Sanmaan’ INDUSEM award was presented to Ar. Pratima Joshi by Professor Dr. Jonathan Jones, President of the American Academy of Emergency Medicine was the Chief Guest for the event. The award was presented on the occasion of the 19th Annual All India Academic Conclave of Emergency Medicine in August 2023. Previous Next 1 2 3 testimonials “Due to my old age, my granddaughter would assist me to the community toilet. I worried for her safety. I am extremely grateful to Shelter Associates who came as a blessing and solved my biggest problem by giving us a toilet at our home.” - Lata Misal, Beneficiary from Pune “The One Home One Toilet model is robust and can be scaled easily to other urban areas within the country. With SA’s and Pune Municipal Corporation’s partnership, we are confident of achieving the targets under Swachh Bharat Abhiyan.” - Kunal Kumar, Municipal Commissioner of Pune “Pratima Joshi and Shelter Associates have been one of our amazing NGO partners who have educated us on the social sector space and the importance of data and technology to create social impact. Pratima Joshi is a super inspiring woman and Founder.” - Donald Lobo, Founder, Chintu Gudiya Foundation Videos Slide-1 Pratima Joshi at TEDxPune Sanitation Champion Digital Addressing in Slums Our Partners slide-2 Shelter Associates SA was founded by architects in 1994 with a passion to ensure equitable access to essential services for the urban poor. SA follows a data-driven, multistakeholder approach to designing and implementing community-centric solutions around sanitation and social housing issues. thought: The website does not seem to have any of the characteristics of a scam website. It is not claiming unrealistic benefits, there is no misleading information, and the payment methods are not unusual. Also, the website is for a well-established non-profit organization. Based on the characteristics of a scam website, this URL is not a scam website. {
